doc.after: The preferred habitats of the Bengal slow loris range across tropical and subtropical regions, and include evergreen and semi-evergreen rainforests with forest edges and continuous, dense canopies.[6] It can also be found in bamboo groves.[19] It prefers habitats with larger diameter, tall trees with a large crown depth (defined as the length along the main axis from the tree tip to the base of the crown); these areas are typically associated with greater food abundance, and decreased risk of predation.[20] Because of its preference for dense forests, it acts as a good indicator of the ecosystem's health.[6]
